technical_skills: Computer vision: image classification, segmentation, object detection
Image preprocessing and analysis (normalization, augmentation, filtering, contrast enhancement)
Annotation quality handling (label smoothing, consensus modeling, uncertainty quantification, human-in-the-loop)
experience_requirements: 4+ years developing and deploying computer vision models in production
Strong experience in cosmetic or defect grading for manufacturing/logistics/visual inspection
Proven work with classification, segmentation, and object detection
Experience building end-to-end image data pipelines
Integration of models into production workflows with multidisciplinary teams
key_responsibilities: Design, train, and deploy CNN-based models for fine-grained visual inspection and defect detection
Apply advanced image analysis (segmentation, feature extraction, contrast enhancement) to improve accuracy
Build cosmetic grading models to classify surface conditions and assign quality grades
Develop techniques to address annotation inconsistencies (soft labels, consensus, uncertainty, HITL)
Architect and manage image data pipelines from acquisition to annotation and training
Collaborate with software, QA, and hardware teams to integrate models into production
education_requirements: Not specified (BS/MS in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering, or related typically preferred)
nice_to_have: Experience with cosmetic standards for mobile device grading
Uncertainty quantification and active learning experience
Hands-on experience with labeling tools and annotation operations
Edge deployment for high-throughput visual inspection

location_requirements.notes: Company emphasizes LATAM talent but no explicit location in posting

benefits: Transparent workplace where everyone has a voice
tools_and_technologies: Edge/IoT components for visual inspection pipelines
industry_knowledge: Manufacturing quality control and visual inspection
key_projects: Cosmetic grading model for mobile device surface defects
Image data pipeline from acquisition to annotation and model training
Production integration of inspection models into QA workflows
career_growth: Learning and growth available to everyone based on merit
Opportunities to work on cutting-edge AI problems
diversity_inclusion: Transparent, inclusive environment valuing passion, honesty, diligence, collaboration, and respect across backgrounds
company_values: Having fun and strong team culture

strengths: End-to-end delivery of a computer-vision production-control system in an industrial plant (object detection/tracking, edge, IoT, real-time dashboards)
Strong Python and deep learning experience (PyTorch, TensorFlow/Keras) with multiple deployed projects
Proven production integration and collaboration with cross-functional teams; English C1/C2 with high-stakes presentations
Solid image processing foundation (OpenCV, preprocessing, remote sensing imagery)
Cloud exposure (AWS/GCP) and MLOps practices (CI/CD, containers)
gaps: Limited direct experience specifically in cosmetic grading of mobile devices
Limited explicit use of annotation inconsistency techniques (soft labeling, consensus modeling, uncertainty quantification, human-in-the-loop)
Slightly under the 4+ years requirement for production CV (approx. 3 years professional CV, plus projects)
Less emphasis on advanced segmentation-heavy pipelines for micro-defect localization

score_explanation: Technical (0.78): Strong matches in Python, PyTorch/TensorFlow, object detection, preprocessing, OpenCV, and end-to-end pipelines; partial gap in cosmetic grading domain and annotation inconsistency methods.

Soft skills (0.88): Demonstrated cross-functional leadership, stakeholder communication, mentoring, and high-stakes presentations in English; aligns with collaborative culture and clear communication requirements.

Experience (0.83): ~3 years leading/deploying CV systems in an industrial context plus earlier CV internship and multiple production-like projects; role similarity high though slightly below 4+ years threshold.
Education (0.90): Telecommunications Engineering degree with high GPA, Data Science diploma, and Stanford ML Specialization; exceeds typical expectations for theoretical grounding.
Industry (0.75): Clear manufacturing/Industry 4.0 exposure and production inspection experience; lacks direct mobile device cosmetic grading background.

Overall (0.82): Weighted composite of all categories, with major strengths in end-to-end CV engineering and communication; primary gaps are domain-specific cosmetic grading and advanced annotation inconsistency techniques.
